steps: Construct a URL with double URL encoding to traverse directories, e.g., http://doc.rt.informaticacloud.com/infocenter/ActiveVOS/v92/topic/com.activee.bpep.doc/images/..%252f..%252f..%252f..%252f..%252f..%252f..%252f..%252fetc/passwd
Access the constructed URL in a web browser or via a tool like curl to read the contents of the /etc/passwd file
vuln_description: The vulnerability allows an attacker to read arbitrary files on the system by exploiting a path traversal flaw via double URL encoding in the web application's URL. This bypasses normal security checks that might prevent directory traversal attacks.
reason: The attack involves a straightforward manipulation of the URL to include double-encoded directory traversal sequences. This technique is well-known and does not require understanding complex application states or novel logic. The interaction between the URL encoding and the server's path resolution is a common vulnerability pattern.
